description: From Latin hēpatītis, from hēpar (“liver”), from Ancient Greek ἧπαρ (hêpar, “liver”); surface analysis, hepat- +‎ -itis.

nouns.description: hepatitis (countable and uncountable, plural hepatitises or hepatitides)

entries.meaning: Inflammation of the liver, sometimes caused by a viral infection.
examples: Hepatitises B and C are the most important chronic viral infections of humans.
